title: Distributed Ledger
content:
- ### OntologyBlock
  id:: distributed-ledger-ontology
  collapsed:: true
	- ontology:: true
	- term-id:: BC-0002
	- preferred-term:: Distributed Ledger
	- status:: complete
	- public-access:: true
	- definition:: A distributed ledger is a database architecture where multiple identical copies of a ledger are maintained across different nodes in a network, with updates replicated and synchronized through a consensus mechanism, eliminating the need for a central authority to prevent manipulation and maintain data integrity.
	- source:: [[ISO/IEC 23257:2021]], [[ITU-T Y.4560]]
	- maturity:: mature
	- owl:class:: bc:DistributedLedger
	- owl:physicality:: VirtualEntity
	- owl:role:: Object
	- owl:inferred-class:: bc:VirtualObject
	- belongsToDomain:: [[BlockchainDomain]]
	- implementedInLayer:: [[ConceptualLayer]]
	- #### Relationships
	  id:: distributed-ledger-relationships
	  collapsed:: true
		- is-subclass-of:: [[Distributed System]]
		- is-subclass-of:: [[Data Structure]]
		- is-subclass-of:: [[Record-Keeping System]]

ontology.definition: A distributed ledger is a database architecture where multiple identical copies of a ledger are maintained across different nodes in a network, with updates replicated and synchronized through a consensus mechanism, eliminating the need for a central authority to prevent manipulation and maintain data integrity.
